Email: info@okeervpark.com

About
.entry-header
.post-thumbnail
About Water’s Edge Motor-Coach & RV Resort
Come and relax in this beautiful, fun and friendly environment. We are surrounded by  beautiful Lake Okeechobee. Our 30 RV  sites  are large  and all have pavers. .  We are a family and pet friendly RV Resort with boat ramps located near Okeechobee FL where you can escape the crowds.  We invite you to experience the tranquility of Water’s Edge Motor-Coach & RV Resort in Okeechobee FL. We are the perfect get away for a quiet and relaxing stay. We only offer only 30 campsites and all of them are private and beautifully landscaped. We are located on the Rim Canal which is a deep and scenic channel that runs along the perimeter of Lake Okeechobee. Lake Okeechobee is Florida’s biggest lake and offers unique beauty, tropical foliage and diverse wildlife. Water’s Edge Motor-Coach & RV Resort is the perfect base for adventures like fresh water fishing, boating and hiking. It is also the perfect place to stay while exploring the Lake Okeechobee Scenic Trail. We’re located close to shopping and restaurants in the town of Okeechobee. Water’s Edge Motor-Coach & RV Resort in Okeechobee FL is close to the Seminole Casino, Orlando theme parks, Vero Beach Outlets and is only forty miles from the beautiful beaches on Florida’s east coast. For more information about the area check out the
Lake Okeechobee page at Visit Florida
. Water’s Edge Motor-Coach & RV Resort is a pet friendly RV Resort in Okeechobee FL Camping amenities include an outdoor pool, boat ramps, Chickee Hut and a clubhouse. We look forward to hosting you!
Campground Rules
Office hours: Very
Call Office at: (863) 357-5757
Check in: 1pm • Check out: Noon
Quiet Time: 10pm – 8am
Pool Hours: 9am – 9 pm
RV Park Map
.entry-content

Festivals & Events
.entry-header
.post-thumbnail
Annual Adam Bryant Minimal Regatta Event
The Adam Bryant Minimal Regatta is a homemade boat race with a twist. You must construct your boat from minimal supplies.
Brighton Seminole Tribal Fair
Expect to see horse races, native dances, rodeos, carnival, comedy and, of course, great live music. Food booths are local and include great Seminole food, but there will be something for everyone in the Pro Rodeo Fan Zone just before the arena.
Battle of Okeechobee
The re-enactment raises public awareness about this historic battle.
Big “O” Birding Festival
Glades and Hendry counties are a mecca for bird watching.  Get your binoculars and search for more than 300 species of birds, including Limpkins, migratory Swallow-Tailed Kites, and Painted Buntings between October and April.
Craft Fair in the Woods
Artists and craftsmen display and sell handmade items amongst the huge cypress, cabbage and oak trees.
Fishermen’s Village Festival of Lights
Over a million lights and themed decorations during December.
Florida Cracker Trail Cross-State Ride
This annual cross state ride commemorates the dedication the Florida Cracker Trail.
Florida Freshwater Frontier
Explore pristine freshwater rivers and lakes by canoe or kayak. Discover unique elements of the original Florida frontier. Explore antique towns, or play a round of golf on a scenic course under sun-kissed skies.
Florida Strawberry Festival
A time in American history when fairs and festivals brought communities together through celebrations of their harvests continues here.
Okeechobee County Fair
Thundering Spirit Family POW WOW
An outstanding collection of Native American artisans and traders bring their creativity, culture and crafts to this amazing event.
.entry-content
